mdRecord.dcterms:title: Audiometer replica
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Dr. R. Quisling [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: One of the first audiometers was developed by David Edward Hughes in 1879 using an induction coil system. A commercial version was manufactured by Thomas Hawsley around 1885 in London, England. This replica was built by Dr. R. Quisling of Harrisonburg, Virginia, during the mid to late 20th century. [original]
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: audiometers
models (representations)
